title: How to Easily Make Lasagna With Oven Noodles

steps.headline: Decide whether your are going to make your own red sauce or use a store bought kind.
Combine one pound of Italian sausage with a 1/2 pound of ground beef.
steps.description: Place the meat mixture in a frying pan and  brown it. Skip this step if you would prefer to make a vegetarian lasagna.

steps.headline: Drain the meat once it is fully cooked.
steps.description: Draining the meat will reduce the grease and make your lasagna a bit healthier. Set the meat aside.

steps.headline: Put 16 oz of ricotta cheese into a bowl.
steps.description: Add an egg and beat the mixture until it is thoroughly combined. Set this bowl aside. You will use it later when layering the lasagna as a way to separate layers and hold the noodles together.

steps.headline: Shred a block of mozzarella cheese with a cheese grater.
steps.description: You should shred enough for four cups of mozzarella cheese.

steps.headline: Combine one cup of Parmesan cheese with the shredded mozzarella.
steps.description: This mixture will be used to create it's own layer in the lasagna. Another option is to combine the ricotta, Parmesan, mozzarella and egg in one large bowl. Make sure to mix them well.

steps.headline: Preheat your oven to 350 degrees.
steps.description: Lay all of your ingredient bowls out in an assembly line to make the layering process quicker and more efficient. If you are making your lasagna with your friends or your kids, assign each person a layer to be in charge of. This may slow down the layering process a little but it will be fun.

steps.headline: In a 9" x 13" pan, spread 1 and 1/2 cups of sauce.
steps.description: Make sure to coat the pan evenly.

steps.headline: Top your layer of sauce with four sheets of lasagna oven noodles.
Spread one cup of the ricotta cheese mixture on top of the noodles with a knife.
steps.description: The ricotta will act as a base layer for the rest of the cheese. It will also hold your noodles together. If you chose to combine all of the cheese, spread 1/2 of the cheese mixture over the noodles. Set the other half aside.

steps.headline: Sprinkle the mozzarella and Parmesan mixture over the ricotta.
steps.description: Keep in mind how many layers of cheese you would like and save enough of the mixture for each layer. The number of layers in your lasagna is entirely up to you.

steps.headline: Top the cheese mixture with 1/3 of the meat mixture.
steps.description: Top the meat layer with another sauce layer.

steps.headline: Repeat the layering process.
steps.description: Sauce, pasta noodles, cheese, and then meat covered by sauce.

steps.headline: Top your final layer with the last four sheets of lasagna oven noodles.
steps.description: Add the rest of the sauce to cover the noodles.

steps.headline: Sprinkle the remaining mozzarella and Parmesan cheese onto the sauce.
steps.description: This will melt on top and hold the top layer together.

steps.headline: Sprinkle the top layer with a pinch of garlic powder or garlic salt.
steps.description: Place a garnish of parsley on top. Add as much or as little as you like. This is an optional step. (to taste).

steps.headline: Wrap the lasagna tightly with foil.
steps.description: Place the lasagna on a cookie sheet in case it bubbles over.

steps.headline: Bake the lasagna for about 30 minutes while it is covered with tin foil.
steps.description: Remove the cover and bake for an additional 15 minutes or until the top layer of the lasagna is light brown and bubbly. Turn the oven off and let the lasagna stand for 10 minutes. This will give the lasagna time to settle.
